title: Flatbread bug
body:
If the yaml file consists of data entries in a directory relative to the general data path flatbread does not create the subdirectories but does write the output yaml file as if the subdirectories were there.
e.g. input:
/data path 
    /subdir
        file1.txt
output:
/datapath
    file1.txt

title: Filter for evidence/number of reads at splice sites
body:
This is now done in `pita/dbcollection.py`:
`for junction in self.db.get_splice_junctions(chrom, ev_count=0, read_count=1):`

This should come from the pita config file.

title: Valid types inconsistency
body:
pita/config.py : `VALID_TYPES = [bed, gff, gff3, gtf]`
whereas pita/io.py has options for
`bed` and `[gff, gff3, gtf3]` 

in other words: when using gtf the program crashes, because 1 class asks you to use `gtf` as type and the other class asks for `gtf3`

title: Make breadcrumb split chromosomes in fractions instead of number of basepairs
body: I figured it would be more convenient to split a chromosome in 4 parts instead of calculating the chromosome size manually first and let the program split it in parts of e.g. 4 mega bases.

title: pita.utr memory usage
body: The default memory for the samtools sort subprocess was hardcoded to 6GB. For servers this would be no problem but the computer I have on my desk crashes because of this. I have currently hot-fixed it to 4GB but a more sophisticated might be better
